body: What operating system are you using? What messages (if any) does sass print out when you start `--watch`?

Mac OSX

When I start watching I get:

`>>> Sass is watching for changes. Press Ctrl-C to stop.
Warning: Unable to load CarbonCore. FSEvents will be unavailable.`

After that it gives me the regualar 'change detected to...' messages, but not with symlinked stuff.
and runny ruby via RVM, btw.

I was able to get rid of the carboncore warning by following Brandon's instructions here:
 http://groups.google.com/group/compass-users/browse_thread/thread/df7d9d0da9ec1eb1

However, symlinked things still don't seem to work with --watch

Hitting this as well. If I had to guess ::Sass::Plugin.watch doesn't confirm that a file in its list of files is a symlink vs a normal file.
UPDATE: I'm pretty sure this is a bug in FSSM.
I'm closing this since we've moved off of FSSM.

I am still experiencing this bug, changes in files that are inside symbolic link folders are not being detected. No errors or anything (I was getting the "Listen has fallen back to polling" message but fixed it by installing `listen`).

I'm on Ubuntu 12.04.
@svivian I can't reproduce this. It works for me on Ubuntu 12.04 using both the polling and the rb-inotify backend.

It doesn't work for me, too. My config is that I have the `styles` folder within which I have a symlink named `other` to a directory containing another `main.scss`. In my `styles/main.scss` file I have `@import other/main.scss`. It doesn't matter if I invoke watch using:

```
$ compass watch --trace .
```

or:

```
$ compass watch --trace styles/main.scss styles/other/main.scss
```

changes in the second file are not detected.

issue.title: Compass doesn't detect changes behind symbolic links

repository.name: compass
repository.description: Compass is no longer actively maintained. Compass is a Stylesheet Authoring Environment that makes your website design simpler to implement and easier to maintain.

issue.body:
My config is that I have the `styles` folder within which I have a symlink named `other` to a directory containing another `main.scss`. In my `styles/main.scss` file I have `@import other/main.scss`. It doesn't matter if I invoke watch using:

```
$ compass watch --trace .
```

or:

```
$ compass watch --trace styles/main.scss styles/other/main.scss
```

changes in the second file are not detected.
My `config.rb` file:

```
http_path = "/"
css_dir = "styles"
sass_dir = "styles"
images_dir = "static/img"
javascripts_dir = "."
fonts_dir = "static/fonts"
output_style = :expanded
relative_assets = false
```

I use OS X 10.8.2, my compass version is 0.12.2.

body:
Okay, I can reproduce this as long as the symlink is pointing outside of the directory being watched. For example:

```
/
  /style
    /other -> ../other
    main.scss
  /other
    main.scss
```

I think this is a listen issue. I've reported it as guard/listen#71.
This is now being tracked on guard/listen#25. I'm going to close it here, but feel free to re-open it if the listen folks decide that they won't implement it there.
